name: Colombian Stewed Flank
author: wifeyluvs2cook
summary: This wonderful dish has so much flavor. It reminds me of the great flavors of Colombian cooking. Slow-cooked, simmered steak makes this dish so tender and juicy! If you desire some heat, like I do, add a jalapeno pepper. You can also substitute beer for half the water for another variation on the flavor. Serve over rice or with tortillas.
ingredients: 2 teaspoons black pepper, or to taste
directions: Heat the corn oil in a skillet over medium heat
Gently lie the steak in the oil and cook each side until brown
Remove the steak to a plate
Add the onions, garlic, tomatoes, salt, pepper, and cumin to the skillet; cook and stir until the onions are tender
Return the steak to the skillet
Pour the water into the skillet
Bring the water to a boil and drop the heat to low; cover
Allow to simmer until the meat easily pulls apart with a fork, about 2 hours
Remove the steak to a cutting board
Use two forks to shred the meat
Pour the onion and tomato mixture from the skillet over the shredded beef
